required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Foreign Body Removal With the Assistance of Ultrasound Guidance and Methylene Blue Staining in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Foreign Body Removal With the Assistance of Ultrasound Guidance and Methylene Blue Staining
clinical_study.source: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Soft-tissue foreign bodies (FB) are very commonly observed in pediatric emergency departments. Some are metallic and can be diagnosed easily via X-ray radiography, whereas others are radiolucent and are hence less easily diagnosed. Not all FB can be removed effectively, even via open surgery and C-arm guidance. This deficiency may potentially be addressed through the ultrasound (US) skills instrument, which is increasingly popular and is convenient for use in the operation room. In the current study, we evaluated the efficiency of FB removal with the assistance of US and methylene blue (MB) staining.

primary_outcome.description: Time from incision made to incision closure

secondary_outcome.description: The blood loss of all the surgery time

arm_group.description: Ultrasound guidance and methylene blue staining
Open surgery without ultrasound guidance and methylene blue staining

intervention.description: Ultrasound guidance and methylene blue staining

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with soft-tissue foreign body
- Must have complete clinical data
Exclusion Criteria:
- Had other injuries
- Presented with more than 3 pieces foreign bodies

facility.name: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: Foreign body removal with the assistance of ultrasound guidance and methylene blue staining in children
